annotation.summary: General feats represent abilities that any character can learn through experience or training, regardless of ancestry or class.
annotation.prerequisites: none; available to any character

annotation.summary: Characters gain a general feat at 3rd level and every 4 levels after that, choosing any general feat for which they meet the prerequisites.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must have reached 3rd level or a subsequent level that is a multiple of 4.

annotation.summary: General feats include skill feats, which enhance what characters can do with their skills. Skill feats have the skill trait, and most characters gain them starting at 2nd level and every two levels after that.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must reach 2nd level or higher to gain skill feats.

annotation.summary: The feature grants the character a skill feat, which must be a general feat possessing the skill trait. The level of a skill feat usually corresponds to the earliest level a character could meet its proficiency requirement.
annotation.prerequisites: Must meet the proficiency requirement of the chosen skill feat.

annotation.summary: Some skill feats are tied to specific skills, while others, such as Assurance, can be selected with multiple or any skills.
annotation.prerequisites: Varies by feat; some require training in a skill.

annotation.summary: A list of general non-skill feats available at various levels, detailing their prerequisites and benefits. These feats provide a range of improvements such as enhanced durability, mobility, perception, and resourcefulness. Some feats grant access to new ancestry options, armor or weapon training, or special actions like creating cover or improving initiative.
annotation.action_economy: Most feats listed are passive or modify existing actions (e.g., Shield Block uses a reaction, Barricade likely uses an action). Specific action costs are not detailed in the text.

annotation.summary: Allows a character to select and use ancestry feats that belong to a different ancestry than their own.
annotation.prerequisites: must have access to ancestry feats or meet any specific ancestry-related requirements

annotation.summary: Improves a character's ability to perform tasks with skills they are not trained in.
annotation.prerequisites: none

annotation.summary: The paragraph lists several level 1 skill feats, each requiring training in specific skills. Assurance allows a fixed result on skill checks, Dubious Knowledge provides both true and false information on failed Recall Knowledge checks, and Quick Identification enables identifying magic more quickly.

action_economy.Dubious Knowledge: Triggered on failed Recall Knowledge check

prerequisites.Assurance: Trained in at least one skill
prerequisites.Dubious Knowledge: Trained in a skill with the Recall Knowledge action
prerequisites.Quick Identification: Trained in Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion

annotation.summary: Indicates that the character is trained in a skill that allows the use of the Recall Knowledge action.
annotation.action_economy: Varies depending on the skill; typically a single action to Recall Knowledge.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must be trained in a skill that supports the Recall Knowledge action.

annotation.summary: When a Knowledge skill check fails, the character still gains information, but it may include both accurate and inaccurate details.
annotation.action_economy: Varies; typically part of a skill check action.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to the relevant Knowledge skill.

annotation.summary: This section lists various skill feats from a tabletop role-playing game, organized by skill (e.g., Arcana, Acrobatics, Athletics, Computers, Crafting). Each feat includes its level requirement, prerequisites such as training or mastery in a skill, and the benefits it provides, such as performing certain actions more efficiently, gaining bonuses, or using abilities as free or reaction actions.

prerequisites.Recognize Spell: Trained in Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion
prerequisites.Seasoned: Trained in Alcohol Lore, Cooking Lore, or Crafting
prerequisites.Trick Magic Item: Trained in Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion
prerequisites.Without a Trace: Trained in Deception, Stealth, or Underworld Lore
prerequisites.Automatic Knowledge: Expert in Recall Knowledge, Assurance in the relevant skill action
prerequisites.Quick Recognition: Master in Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion; Recognize Spell

annotation.summary: The paragraph indicates that the character must be an expert in the Recall Knowledge skill and possess the Assurance feat for the relevant skill.
prerequisites: Assurance feat in the relevant skill

annotation.summary: The paragraph lists various skill feats for Crafting, Deception, Diplomacy, Intimidation, and Lore. Each feat includes its level requirement, prerequisite skill proficiency, and a short description of its benefit. The feats progress from basic abilities available to trained characters to powerful options for masters and legendary practitioners, expanding what characters can accomplish with each skill.
annotation.action_economy: Most feats modify downtime or skill actions rather than combat actions; some allow faster or more efficient use of existing actions such as crafting, repairing, disguising, or demoralizing.

annotation.summary: A list of skill feats related to the Diplomacy and Intimidation skills, categorizing various social and influence-based abilities that characters can learn or use in gameplay.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by feat; typically uses actions such as single actions or free actions depending on the specific feat's description.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires training or proficiency in the Diplomacy or Intimidation skill, depending on the feat.

annotation.summary: This section lists abilities and feats related to fear effects and lore-based skill enhancements, including Terrified Retreat, Scare to Death, and Lore Skill Feats.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by ability; typically a single action or reaction for fear effects, passive for lore feats.
annotation.prerequisites: Relevant skill proficiency (e.g., Intimidation or Lore) and level requirements as specified by each feat.

annotation.summary: This section lists various skill feats for multiple skills in a tabletop role-playing game, including Lore, Medicine, Nature, Occultism, Performance, Piloting, Religion, and Society. Each feat entry provides its level, prerequisites (usually a proficiency rank in the related skill), and a short description of its benefits. The feats progress from basic trained-level abilities to legendary-level mastery, granting increasingly powerful or specialized effects such as healing, renown, enhanced perception, divine insight, or mastery of vehicles.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by feat; most feats modify or enhance existing skill actions such as Treat Wounds, Perform, or Drive, typically using standard action types defined elsewhere in the rules.
annotation.prerequisites: Each feat requires a minimum proficiency rank (Trained, Expert, Master, or Legendary) in the associated skill, and some require additional conditions such as being a follower of a specific religion or having another feat (e.g., Akashic Sync for Akashic Transcendence).

annotation.summary: A list of Society and Stealth skill feats with their levels, prerequisites, and benefits. Society feats include Multilingual, Plant Rumor, Read Lips, Sign Language, Streetwise, Legendary Codebreaker, and Legendary Linguist, offering language, communication, and information-gathering abilities. Stealth feats include Experienced Smuggler, improving concealment of items.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by feat; most are passive or used as part of skill checks rather than consuming specific actions.

annotation.summary: A list of Stealth-related skill feats detailing their level requirements, Stealth proficiency prerequisites, and benefits such as improved concealment, group sneaking, countering special senses, and enhanced movement while sneaking.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by feat; generally modifies or enhances the Sneak action rather than adding new actions.

annotation.summary: A list of Survival skill feats that grant various benefits such as improved tracking, identifying wildlife, terrain expertise, urban navigation, crafting with monster parts, surviving on other planes, and enduring extreme conditions. Each feat requires a specific level of proficiency in the Survival skill.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by feat; most are exploration or downtime activities rather than combat actions.

annotation.summary: A list of Thievery skill feats detailing their level requirements, prerequisites, and benefits, ranging from basic pickpocketing to legendary theft abilities.

action_economy.Pickpocket: Varies (part of Steal or Palm an Object action)

annotation.summary: The character selects a specific Lore subcategory to become trained in, and later gains additional skill increases for that Lore at levels 3, 7, and 15.
annotation.prerequisites: None

annotation.summary: This feat can be taken multiple times, each time applying to a different Lore subcategory, granting additional skill increases at specified levels.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have access to the Lore skill or a related feat allowing Lore specialization.

annotation.summary: This feature allows a character to adopt another ancestry's cultural traits, granting access to that ancestry's feats in addition to their own.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to or connection with another ancestry through birth, rite, or relationship

annotation.summary: A character can select ancestry feats from another ancestry if those feats do not depend on physical traits the character does not possess, subject to the GM's approval.
annotation.prerequisites: GM approval; must meet any non-physiological requirements of the chosen ancestry feat.

annotation.summary: A general skill-based action involving healing that requires manipulation, likely used to restore health or treat injuries.
annotation.action_economy: varies depending on system; typically one action or activity
annotation.prerequisites: training or proficiency in a healing-related skill

annotation.summary: Akashic Sync is a level 7 feat that can be activated with one action, likely involving mental or psychic synchronization with the Akashic Record or similar knowledge source.
annotation.prerequisites: None explicitly stated, but likely requires access to Akashic or psychic class features.

annotation.summary: Allows the user to tap into the Akashic Records to Recall Knowledge using the Occultism skill for any subject, regardless of the usual applicable skill.
annotation.action_economy: varies (same as Recall Knowledge, typically 1 action)
annotation.prerequisites: ability to use Occultism skill

annotation.summary: On a critical success, the character recalls information accurately and obtains three relevant pieces of knowledge or context.
annotation.prerequisites: A check that allows for critical success outcomes, typically a Recall Knowledge or similar action.

annotation.summary: On a successful check, the character recalls two correct pieces of information and one incorrect piece, without being able to tell which is false.
annotation.action_economy: Varies; typically part of a Recall Knowledge action or similar check.
annotation.prerequisites: A successful knowledge or recall-related check.

annotation.summary: On a failed check, the character receives one accurate piece of information or context along with two incorrect or misleading details.
annotation.prerequisites: A roll or check that can result in failure

annotation.summary: The character gains a 1st-level ancestry feat, representing a stronger connection to their heritage through instinct, study, or magic.
annotation.prerequisites: none

annotation.summary: This feat can be taken multiple times, granting training in progressively heavier types of armor with each selection.
annotation.prerequisites: Must meet the requirements for the next armor type as described in the related rules.

annotation.summary: The rule requires the character to be trained in at least one skill before using or selecting this feature.
annotation.prerequisites: Trained in at least one skill

annotation.summary: Allows a trained character to automatically take a fixed result of 10 plus proficiency bonus on a chosen skill instead of rolling, regardless of conditions.
annotation.action_economy: None (passive or optional replacement for a skill check)
annotation.prerequisites: Must be trained in the chosen skill

annotation.summary: This feat can be taken more than once, with each selection applying to a different skill and granting its associated benefits.

This feat allows a character to implant one augmentation whose item level is equal to or lower than their character level, without counting toward their implant limit. The first augmentation gained through this feat is free if its item level is 1 or lower, and it can later be upgraded.
annotation.prerequisites: character level sufficient to meet augmentation item level requirement

annotation.summary: You can replace an existing augmentation with another when leveling up or during downtime, paying any cost difference between the old and new augmentations.
annotation.prerequisites: must already possess an augmentation to replace

annotation.summary: This feat can be taken multiple times, each instance granting a different augmentation. If retrained, the cost of the original augmentation must be paid.
The ability requires the character to be an expert in a skill that can use the Recall Knowledge action and to possess the Assurance feat for that same skill.
prerequisites: Expert in a skill with the Recall Knowledge action

annotation.summary: Allows a character to use Recall Knowledge as a free action once per round with a chosen expert-level skill that has the Recall Knowledge action and for which they possess the Assurance feat. The check must use Assurance.
annotation.action_economy: Free action, usable once per round
prerequisites: Expert proficiency in the chosen skill

annotation.summary: This feat can be taken multiple times, each time applying to a different skill. The Automatic Knowledge ability can be used with any chosen skill, but only once per round.
annotation.prerequisites: must have selected the feat for the relevant skill

annotation.summary: Battle Medicine is a first-level feat that allows a character to heal an ally using medical skill during combat as a single action.
annotation.prerequisites: Trained in Medicine

annotation.summary: A general skill-based action involving healing that requires manipulation, likely used to restore health or treat injuries.
annotation.action_economy: varies by system; typically one action or equivalent
annotation.prerequisites: training or proficiency in a healing-related skill

annotation.summary: This ability allows a character to use their knowledge of society to blend into crowds or impersonate generic individuals. In crowds of ten or more, Society can replace Stealth for Avoid Notice, and in settlements, Society can replace Deception for impersonating a non-specific person.
annotation.action_economy: Exploration activity (Avoid Notice) and downtime or social interaction (Impersonate)
annotation.prerequisites: Must be in a crowd of at least 10 creatures for Avoid Notice substitution; must be in a settlement for Impersonation substitution.

annotation.summary: A general exploration skill action related to healing that requires concentration.
annotation.prerequisites: Training or proficiency in a relevant healing skill

annotation.summary: This feature enhances jumping ability, tripling the distance of successful Long Jumps and allowing High Jumps to use Long Jump distances without tripling.
annotation.action_economy: Varies; typically part of a movement action when performing a jump.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires a successful Athletics check for Long or High Jump.

annotation.summary: This entry denotes an action or ability that involves making an attack, is broadly applicable (general), requires physical or deliberate manipulation, and is tied to a skill check.
annotation.prerequisites: None

annotation.summary: Player characters can assist another character in crafting an item by making a skill check under the main crafter’s direction.
annotation.action_economy: Typically part of downtime crafting actions; helper contributes a check during the crafting process.
annotation.prerequisites: At least one PC must be engaged in crafting; helper must have a relevant skill to contribute.

annotation.summary: A trained ally can assist in crafting by using Crafting or another relevant skill determined by the GM. Their check affects material cost reduction based on the Earn Income table, using their proficiency rank and level minus one.
annotation.prerequisites: Helper must be trained in Crafting or another skill relevant to the item as determined by the GM.

annotation.summary: This rule allows a crafter to ignore most item creation requirements if they possess the relevant Crafting feat and meet level and proficiency thresholds, though they must still pay any associated costs and cannot bypass restrictions on special or exclusive items. The GM has final authority on what requirements can be ignored.
prerequisites: Appropriate Crafting skill feat (e.g., Magical Crafting)

annotation.summary: Temporarily increases the character's carrying capacity for 1 minute, scaling with proficiency rank, but causes fatigue afterward.
annotation.action_economy: none specified (likely free or passive activation)
annotation.prerequisites: none explicitly stated; scaling depends on proficiency rank

annotation.summary: When communicating through a comm unit, datapad, or computer, you can attempt a linguistic skill action on a creature that doesn't understand your language by rolling a flat check (DC 15, or DC 10 if Legendary in Society). On success, the effect functions as if the creature understood you.
prerequisites: Access to a comm unit, datapad, or computer
Optional: Legendary proficiency in Society for reduced DC

annotation.summary: Dive for Cover is a level 2 feat that allows a character to use a single action to quickly move into a safer position, typically to gain cover or improve defenses against an attack.
annotation.prerequisites: Level 2 or higher

annotation.summary: By studying your sacred texts for 10 minutes and making a Religion check, you can find divine insight or guidance relevant to a personal problem or dilemma.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to read and interpret religious scriptures of your deity or philosophy

annotation.summary: The rule requires the character to be trained in any skill that allows the Recall Knowledge action.
annotation.prerequisites: Trained in a skill with the Recall Knowledge action

annotation.summary: When you fail a Recall Knowledge check (but not critically), you receive both the correct and an incorrect piece of information without knowing which is true.
annotation.prerequisites: ability to attempt Recall Knowledge checks

annotation.summary: This feature improves your ability to Gather Information, reducing the time required and mitigating critical failures when you are a master in Diplomacy.
annotation.prerequisites: Master in Diplomacy

annotation.summary: A first-level feat that allows a character to make an intimidating attack using a single action.
annotation.prerequisites: None explicitly stated

annotation.summary: Players can create uncommon or rare formulas with GM approval, usually at a higher difficulty. The Machine Magic feat is required for hybrid items, and the Magical Crafting feat is required for magical formulas.
prerequisites: Machine Magic feat for hybrid items
Magical Crafting feat for magical formulas

annotation.summary: A set of trait keywords describing the nature and mechanics of an ability or effect, indicating it involves sound, emotions, luck, general applicability, language, mental influence, and a skill component.
A level 2 feat that can be performed with a single action, likely involving healing or providing comfort to an ally.
annotation.prerequisites: None explicitly stated

annotation.summary: Allows a character to use the Society skill to Decipher Writing at normal reading speed, gaining improved results when spending additional time.
annotation.action_economy: Varies; can be performed at normal reading speed or with the full Decipher Writing time for enhanced results.
annotation.prerequisites: Proficiency in the Society skill and the ability to use the Decipher Writing action.

annotation.summary: The ability allows a character to instantly create a simplified pidgin language to communicate basic ideas with any creature that has a language, provided the character understands the creature’s communication medium.
annotation.prerequisites: Must understand the creature’s communication medium (e.g., speech, sign language).

annotation.summary: A high-level feat that allows a character to perform an extraordinary act of persuasion or diplomacy using all three of their actions in a turn.
annotation.prerequisites: Character level 15 or higher

annotation.summary: Allows a character to quickly attempt to negotiate during a hostile or tense situation by making a Diplomacy check at a –5 penalty to persuade an opponent to stop their current action and talk.
annotation.action_economy: Varies (uses the Make an Impression and Request actions, typically taking multiple actions)
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to use the Diplomacy skill; target must be capable of communication and willing to consider negotiation

annotation.summary: Your widespread fame improves how socially aware creatures perceive you, adjusting their attitude one step more favorable based on your reputation. When performing to earn income, your notoriety draws higher-level audiences than the venue would normally attract.
prerequisites: ability to Earn Income with Performance

annotation.summary: The character's widespread fame enhances their ability to earn income using a Lore skill, functioning like the Legendary Performer ability but granting access to higher-level jobs.
A high-level feat available to characters at level 15 that can be used with one action, likely granting abilities or traits associated with a legendary troll.
annotation.prerequisites: Character level 15

annotation.summary: Make a Deception check against a target’s Will DC within 60 feet. Success makes the target off-guard for 1 round; critical success confuses it for 1 round. You also gain information as if you had successfully used Recall Knowledge. The target becomes temporarily immune to further attempts for 24 hours.
prerequisites: Must be able to use the Legendary Troll ability

annotation.summary: This feat allows the character to craft magic items, granting them four formulas for common magic items of 2nd level or lower upon selection. Some items may have additional requirements.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to Craft; access to appropriate tools and materials

annotation.summary: This ability causes others to assume you are a professional in workplace or office contexts unless you act otherwise. It allows you to use the Society skill to Make an Impression or to Impersonate professionals, granting a +1 circumstance bonus when using the usual skills for those actions.
annotation.action_economy: varies (depends on Make an Impression or Impersonate action)
annotation.prerequisites: none specified

annotation.summary: This feat can be taken more than once, granting additional languages each time it is selected.
annotation.prerequisites: none

annotation.summary: A level 1 feat named 'No Cause for Alarm' that requires three actions to use.
A set of trait keywords describing an ability or action that involves sound, focus, emotional influence, general applicability, language use, and mental effort, and is tied to a skill.
annotation.prerequisites: None indicated.

annotation.summary: A level 2 feat named Percussive Maintenance that requires one action to use.
Allows the character to create digital forgeries using the Computers skill instead of the Society skill, with forgery checks opposed by the character’s Computers skill.
annotation.action_economy: varies (same as Create a Forgery action)

annotation.summary: This special rule allows a character with either the Combat Hack or Digital Diversion skill feat to use this feat without needing a hacking toolkit.
annotation.action_economy: Varies depending on the associated feat (Combat Hack or Create a Diversion).

annotation.summary: Allows a character to use the Survival skill to Subsist on any plane, even those lacking natural resources, and to protect themselves and supported allies from environmental damage caused by the plane’s general conditions.
annotation.action_economy: Varies (as per Subsist activity, typically downtime or exploration action)
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to use the Survival skill; access to this planar subsistence feature or feat

annotation.summary: This entry lists the trait keywords associated with an ability or rule, indicating it involves hearing, general application, language use, mental processes, and a skill component.
Power Slide is a level 3 feat that can be performed using between one and three actions, allowing flexible use depending on the situation.
annotation.prerequisites: None specified

annotation.summary: The character can spend 1 minute to retrieve a previously unlisted but plausibly purchased piece of adventuring gear from their backpack, representing foresight and preparation. The item must be common, non-magical, non-weapon, non-armor, and of a level no higher than half the character's level, with Bulk low enough to avoid encumbrance.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have a backpack and sufficient carrying capacity; item must meet level and Bulk restrictions.

annotation.summary: The ability allows a character to prepare a disguise much faster than normal. Masters in Deception can create and use a disguise as a 3-action activity, while legendary users can do so in a single action.
annotation.prerequisites: Training in Deception; benefits improve at Master and Legendary proficiency levels.

annotation.summary: Allows the character to Recognize a Spell once per round as a free action when using a skill in which they are a master.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be a master in the skill used to Recognize a Spell

annotation.summary: Allows a group to make a single Stealth check using the lowest modifier when Avoiding Notice and following the expert, instead of rolling individually. Does not affect initiative rolls.

Allows a character to understand spoken words by reading lips of visible speakers in known languages. Works automatically outside encounters, but requires a Society check and imposes fascinated and off-guard conditions during focused lipreading in encounters.
annotation.action_economy: Requires focus during each round in encounter mode; automatic outside encounters.
annotation.prerequisites: Must know the language being read; must be able to clearly see the speaker.

annotation.summary: Recognize Spell is a level 1 reaction feat that allows a character to identify a spell as it is being cast.
annotation.prerequisites: None explicitly stated; typically available to characters trained in Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion.

annotation.summary: Characters trained in the skill corresponding to a spell's tradition automatically identify common spells of 2nd rank or lower, with higher ranks identified automatically as their proficiency increases. The GM secretly rolls the appropriate skill check to determine identification results, and untrained characters cannot succeed.
annotation.action_economy: None (passive or reaction to observing a spell being cast)
annotation.prerequisites: Training in the skill corresponding to the spell's tradition (Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion)

annotation.summary: A high-level feat that allows a character to attempt to frighten or instantly defeat a foe through sheer terror, using a single action.
annotation.prerequisites: Typically requires mastery in Intimidation or a related fear-inducing ability.

annotation.summary: A skill or effect related to inducing or resisting fear, likely causing incapacitation or emotional disruption.
annotation.prerequisites: None indicated

annotation.summary: Grants a circumstance bonus to Craft checks for food, drink, and serums based on proficiency in certain lore or crafting skills.
annotation.prerequisites: Trained in Alcohol Lore, Cooking Lore, or Crafting

annotation.summary: Allows the character to craft consumable serums and medical items, granting access to four common serum formulas of 2nd level or lower upon selection.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to Craft; selection of this feat

annotation.summary: The character gains trained proficiency in any one skill they choose.
annotation.prerequisites: none

annotation.summary: This feat can be taken more than once, allowing the character to gain training in a different skill with each selection.
annotation.prerequisites: none

annotation.summary: When crafting an item that involves multiple specialties, such as a travel suit requiring both armorsmithing and textiles, a character may only receive part of their skill bonus if they are proficient in only one relevant specialty.
annotation.action_economy: Not specified; applies during item crafting process.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to relevant crafting specialties (e.g., armorsmithing, textiles).

annotation.summary: Lists various crafting specialties and the types of items each applies to, such as armorsmithing for armor and shields, artistry for fine art and jewelry, and others covering vehicles, chemicals, computers, engineering items, firearms, biotech, robotics, and textiles.
annotation.action_economy: Not specified; descriptive reference for crafting categories.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires relevant crafting skill or specialty to create or modify items in the listed category.

annotation.summary: A level 3 feat that can be performed using one action, likely involving taking control of a vehicle or mount.
annotation.prerequisites: Character level 3 or higher

annotation.summary: Allows the character to craft technological items of level 1 or higher, granting four common tech item formulas of level 2 or lower upon selection.
annotation.prerequisites: None explicitly stated; may require access to tech crafting tools or formulas as referenced in the equipment chapter.

annotation.summary: This section lists the possible environmental or terrain types a character can choose when selecting the feat.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be selecting the associated feat to choose one of the listed environments.

annotation.summary: This feat may be taken multiple times, with each selection applying to a different terrain type.
This feat can be taken more than once, with each selection applying to a different terrain type.
A general downtime activity involving the use of a skill and the manipulate trait.
annotation.prerequisites: None specified

annotation.summary: A first-level feat that allows a character to attempt to use a magic item not normally usable by them, typically through a skill check.
annotation.prerequisites: Trained in Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion

annotation.summary: To activate or cast a spell from a magic item, make a skill check using the skill associated with the item's magical tradition or one that includes the spell on its list. The GM sets the DC based on the item's level and circumstances.
annotation.action_economy: Varies depending on the item's activation method; not specified in this paragraph.
annotation.prerequisites: Possession of the magic item and proficiency in the relevant magical tradition skill (Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion).

annotation.summary: When activating a magic item that relies on a spell attack or spell DC, use your level as the proficiency bonus and your best mental ability modifier if you lack proficiency. Higher proficiency in the item's magical tradition improves the effective proficiency bonus.
annotation.action_economy: Varies depending on the item's activation method; not specified in this rule.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to a magic item requiring a spell attack or spell DC; proficiency in the relevant magical tradition may modify the calculation.

annotation.summary: Allows the character to substitute Arcana for Nature, Occultism, or Religion when using skill actions or feats tied to those traditions, and removes penalties or increased DCs for using Arcana on other magical traditions.
annotation.prerequisites: training in Arcana

annotation.summary: This ability ensures accurate knowledge in trained Lore skills. Critical failures on Recall Knowledge checks become failures, and masters gain extra information on critical successes.
annotation.action_economy: None (passive ability affecting Recall Knowledge checks)
annotation.prerequisites: Trained in at least one Lore subcategory

annotation.summary: Grants a bonus to untrained skill checks equal to the character's proficiency bonus.
annotation.prerequisites: none

annotation.summary: Describes how a skill or proficiency bonus scales with character level, starting at level minus two, improving to level minus one at 5th level, and reaching full level at 7th level, without granting access to trained-only actions.
annotation.prerequisites: Character level determines the scaling; no specific training required.

annotation.summary: Lists various performance specialties categorized by type, such as acting, comedy, dance, musical instruments, and vocal performance, each with example subtypes or styles.
annotation.action_economy: Not specified; likely used as part of a skill check or downtime activity rather than a discrete action.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must possess or have access to a relevant performance or artistry skill to select a specialty.

annotation.summary: This feat can be taken multiple times, granting training in a new advanced weapon with each selection.
annotation.prerequisites: none
